meanings.definition: Lack of moderation or restraint in behavior or speech.
meanings.sent1: His intemperateness in yelling at the meeting upset everyone.
meanings.sent2: Her intemperateness in eating sweets led to health issues.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the intemperateness of the talkative parrot.
meanings.sent4: The intemperateness of the storm left a path of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The intemperateness of his outburst made a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: Excessive indulgence in food or drink.
meanings.sent1: The intemperateness of his drinking habits worried his friends.
meanings.sent2: Celebrating with cake and champagne showed her intemperateness.
meanings.sent3: The intemperateness of the buffet at the party left no leftovers.
meanings.sent4: Her intemperateness with desserts was like a sweet addiction.
meanings.sent5: The intemperateness of the feast left everyone feeling stuffed and content.

meanings.sent1: His intemperateness in spending money led to financial troubles.
meanings.sent2: The child's intemperateness in following rules caused chaos.
meanings.sent3: The intemperateness of the puppy's energy was both cute and exhausting.
meanings.sent4: Her intemperateness in procrastination was like a never-ending cycle.
meanings.sent5: The intemperateness of his emotions made it hard for others to understand him.
